item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.title: Recognizing the 10th anniversary of the establishment of the Minority AIDS Initiative.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. (text of measure as introduced: CR S9425-9426)

summary.text:
Commemorates the 10th anniversary of the establishment of the Minority AIDS Initiative.

Commends the efforts of community organizations and health care providers in minority communities to deliver human immunodeficiency virus and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (HIV/AIDS) care and services.

Encourages minorities to educate themselves about the HIV/AIDS prevention and treatment and to reduce the stigma associated with HIV/AIDS.

Expresses support for the continued funding of the Initiative and other federal programs to stop the spread of HIV/AIDS and provide treatment to those affected.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution recognizing the 10th anniversary of the establishment of the Minority AIDS Initiative.

item.title: A concurrent resolution recognizing the 10th anniversary of the establishment of the Minority AIDS Initiative.
A concurrent resolution recognizing the 10th anniversary of the establishment of the Minority AIDS Initiative.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
